channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16952] Replace hadoop-maven-plugins with protobuf-maven-plugin for building protos
item.description:
hadoop-maven-plugins takes less configuration and avoids duplication – having to add .proto file in protobuf dir as well as add it explicitly to pom.xml. This plugin also lets you set more than one source (hadoop-maven-plugins expects you to compile first w/ one dir and then the other).

Thanks to Duo Zhang for pointing out this plugin.
item.summary: Replace hadoop-maven-plugins with protobuf-maven-plugin for building protos

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
https://www.xolstice.org/protobuf-maven-plugin/examples/protoc-artifact.html

Although the documentation here says the they begin to manage the protoc binaries from version 2.6.1, I do find a 2.5.0 protoc in the central maven repo...

https://repo.maven.apache.org/maven2/com/google/protobuf/protoc/2.5.0/

Thanks again for the pointer Duo Zhang

I updated the patch. Now mvn does it all for you. No need of a pre-installed protoc. Should make it easier on devs.
Ignore v002. It was incomplete (I'd prematurely committed v001).

+1.

And the findbugs warnings are from the shaded protobuf classes, not the generated ones. We have already exclude the generated files in findbugs-exclude.xml. I think we should also exclude the shaded sources?
Thanks for review Duo Zhang I made a subissue to add findbugs exludes.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Simplifies .proto manipulations. One step only now -- no need to keep pom.xml listing up to date with the protobuf protos directory content -- and no need to preinstall protoc; mvn does it all for you now.
